reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: The programme works for the improvement of rural communities’ socio-economical situation and quality of life, as well for the strengthening of community capacities in Hoshangabad, Madhya Pradesh State, Central India. This area is among the poorest and le ast developed in India, many villages and communities hard to access, agriculture suffers from the lack of irrigation systems, families’ food security is weak, malnutrition is common and access to safe and clean water sparse. During the programme impleme ntation, the livelihoods of the landless and peasants is improved, the nutrition and health status of community people, especially children under 5 and their mothers is strengthened and the quality of pre and primary school education enhanced. Focus of the programme is especially in reducing children's malnurtition. The programme benefits 42.000 people. The main partner is World Vision India, which is responsible for the programme implementation and for the utilization of the programme resources.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland
